website_summaries.verdict: This is one of the best-selling trackball mice for a reason. With great battery life and an easy-to-use trackball, this is a great solution for those wanting something different than a typical mouse.
pros: This mouse features two programmable buttons and a scroll wheel
Wireless connection can reach up to 30 feet
You can go up to 18 months before changing batteries
cons: Like most trackballs, this one needs to be cleaned on occasion to keep it accurate

website_summaries.verdict: Great for small spaces, the trackball feature provides smooth, wireless mousing for months on a single battery.
pros: Comfortable to use, even for long periods of time — and no mouse pad required
A single AAA battery powers the unit for at least a year
Trackball is easy to clean if it starts getting sluggish
Can even be used while lounging on the sofa
cons: A short learning curve, as it uses the thumb for most of the movement instead of the whole hand like a traditional mouse

customer_reviews.title: Great product that can be made even greater with an angled stand
customer_reviews.text: I've been a trackball user since the days before MP3s. This is my current favorite model. Affordable, reliable, cordless, and nicely shaped. I was using it so much that my arm started hurting until I realized I was using it at the wrong angle. I do 3d printing and designed a stand to make it even better and more ergonomic. I would highly recommend this product especially with a padded rest and angled stand like the one I made. You can find my stand at Thingiverse. [...] and make it yourself if you have a 3d printer. With or without the stand, this trackball is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Rustin L. Haase

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Comfortable Design - Cheap Manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse in December. Very, very comfortable - wonderful to use - actually love it. But 9 months later, the spring holding the battery in place has become too soft. Clearly someone in China cheapened the compression spring and removed one coil - saved cost by a fraction of a penny. The battery frequently falls out and no longer makes contact - making it impossible to use. Very frustrating for such a nice mouse. And very bad for Logitech. I've decided to purchase a different brand and type of mouse. Don't want to buy a new one every 9-10 months. Barry
customer_reviews.author: Barry Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: PIECE OF GARBAGE - STANDARDS NO LONGER WORTHWHILE
customer_reviews.text: I"ve had several of these in the piece - got the first one before shoulder surgery when I knew I would not be able to use my arm for a while. Got a new one - and after just over 3 months, it's dead. Re-set the remote, new battery - did everything one might logically do. And the piece of crap is nothing. THREE MONTHS!! Apparently the quality control standards are no longer in place. Not even heavy enough for a decent paperweight. Seriously disappointed in what used to be a useful product.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Sheehan

customer_reviews.title: Big fan.
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. I am a fan of thumbwheels and they are hard to find. This one is really nice and works well. I love the dongle and it really is plug and play. Battery life is excellent, there is even a slot inside the battery case to house the dongle when not in use so it won't get lost. If you have never used a thumbwheel mouse, they do take some getting used to but I find they really save my wrists and are great for reducing carpal tunnel. UPDATE 02/12/18 - No issues. Still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: JKT

customer_reviews.title: Trackballs are great!
customer_reviews.text: As a long time trackball user, purchased this unit to replace old worn USB version Logitek. This unit is very smooth and tracks well. Wireless works well and requires no setup. One thing to remember with all trackballs, they must be cleaned a minimum of once a week. Hair, dust and grime stick to the ball or fall into the top and build up on the rollers. This results in a less smooth feel when moving. It is easy to pop out the ball and I keep a dust/hair removal brush in my drawer to clean. Also clean the actual ball with damp cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R.

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Trackball works wonderfully in a small area
customer_reviews.text: I have used quite a few different mice in my day and most if not all have been made by Logitech. That is because I trust this company and I believe that they are continuing to improve and develop their product line. Some of the more expensive mice are just out of reach for me but they are really wonderful. I prefer this particular trackball because it works well in a small area and I do not have to move the mouse around I just move the ball instead. I highly recommend this particular mouse trackball for anyone who really wants to minimize their movements.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Gates

customer_reviews.title: Big fan of Logitech
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always been a fan of the trackball, but Logitech found a way to make it better. They put the USB stick into a compartment with the battery, so I can take the whole thing with me to any computer, which I do. The packaging has been updated so you can get it out of plastic too, with a tear away panel that opens it right up. 5 stars for that alone. I’ve replaced my older Logitech trackballs with this newer version and like the movement, buttons, and scroll. They’re easy to clean and last years.
customer_reviews.author: J.Glass

customer_reviews.title: Left Click does not work for newer Mac with usb-C
customer_reviews.text: I can control the position of the cursor and right click, I cannot left click. I've updated the Trackball to the latest firmware: Software Version: 1.2.109 Last Update: 2019-08-20 OS: macOS 10.14 File Size: 27.3 MB I've tried to versions of the latest software: Logitech Control Center Software Version: 3.9.7.56 Last Update: 2018-09-26 and Software Version: 3.9.8 Last Update: 2019-03-27
customer_reviews.author: M.R. Breen

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I loved the style, color and the look of it but for some reason this mouse doesn't provide the ergonomic comfort for me, moreover my thumb was straining too much and I ended up using braces for my right hand. I do a lot of CAD drafting and I feel the position of the track ball will make it very uncomfortable, for the thumb to do the job of the palm is extremely strenuous (at least for me). I had high expectations but I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kathi

customer_reviews.title: I just love this mouse - I now have one for the office and one for home
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is great. I bought one for home to use with my laptop so I don't have to use the track pad. It is really the best. And because it is ergonomic and has the track ball one doesn't have to pick up the mouse and move one's arm and move around the mouse pad, and so on. You will love this and it seems like one never has to change the battery. Of course one does have to change the battery but it is so long between changes that one has no idea when the battery was last put in.
customer_reviews.author: pnut

customer_reviews.title: lOGITECH doesn't disappoint
customer_reviews.text: So being that I had to wait for my monitors I didn't wanna write this review until I had everything setup properly and using it, I have had many different mouse that I used mostly at work this is my first gaming mouse so actually using and getting it operational wasn't a problem I do appreciate the fact logitech put the usb inside the battery housing instead putting anywhere making it easy to lose or misplace, very easy to use it does take a lil getting use too since the track ball is on the side, so if you are left handed user this definitely not for you. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Delivered to wrong address
customer_reviews.text: Review intended for Amazon delivery. I see no other way to write about my delivery. The item pictured is delivered to my porch but is clearly not my mouse since my mouse came in a cardboard box. The item pictured belongs to my neighbor 1 house over and he received my item. We exchanged items and all appears well. I’ll check out the mouse functionality when I return home. I was disappointed in the last mouse (exact copy of this one) as it did not last long. My prior Logitech trackball lasted years! The last one was used 1-3 hours a day and broke before the free battery was even used up!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell D. Elkins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for limited space
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my small space. I have a sit/stand desk, and the mouse area tilts, I use a gel wrist pad mouse pad, and this mouse and it’s perfect. Very comfortable for long periods of time. I had tried a regular mouse and kept having to pick it up and adjust, this eliminates that problem. It is a learning curve to adjust to the thumb scrolling but thankfully I haven’t been on a PC in many years so I had to relearn anyway, and my son even made the change no problem. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic, comfortable, but lasted only 14 months
customer_reviews.text: This trackball was affordable and ergonomic, but did not last long. I really liked it until last month, which is about 13-14 months from date of purchase. Since last month, the left button keeps double-clicking when I single click, and even when pressed for dragging, it releases the button incorrectly. EVen with debounce mitigation, it's pretty hard to use. Looking around on the internet, it seems like this is a common failure mode for this trackball atleast, and some DIY fixes are suggested which involve replacing the physical button switches inside the trackball.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: not good in a noisy RF environment
customer_reviews.text: Wish there was a bluetooth version of this device. Feels great. Movement of the ball is smooth. Shape of the device is a little large for my hand. Back/Forward buttons are placed very awkwardly. The biggest problem is that it is almost useless in a standard desktop computing environment. I have a laptop with a few bluetooth devices, a dual-band WiFi network router across the room. Nothing out of the ordinary for home office work. The mouse is literally about 18 inches from the receiver, and it cannot maintain a reliable connection. The mouse pointer hitches and stutters across the screen, or freezes entirely. Much regret over this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Loren J. Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Missing Receiver
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered two of these. They keep being shipped without the receiver in the container. The first time I thought it was a fluke and I returned the item and ordered a new one. The second one was missing the same part. The phone numbers for the manufacturer don't work, so you can't ask them to send you the part. The receiver is the small piece you plug into your USB port, so the mouse can communicate with the computer. The packaging indicates it should be included, but it isn't there. The mouse is useless without it, so whatever else might be positive about this product is null and void.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne de Cordova

customer_reviews.title: Track Ball Can stick or be s;low to move cross screen
customer_reviews.text: It is nice not to have to move the mouse all over the mouse pad to get the pointer to move from one screen to another. However, the Track ball can stick or move slowly when you are spinning it with you thumb across two screens. Also, occasionally the pointer disappears from the screen or blends into the background and i need to scroll it to one end or another of the screens to get it to appear. Overall, I like it better than a regular mouse and I acknowledge that as i become more experienced using this mouse it is possible, maybe even likely, some some of the foregoing issues will lessen or disappear altogether!
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Skipping cursor and horrible consistency
customer_reviews.text: I had huge expectations for this device. I’ve been a long time Logitech Trackball user, and have loved their previous wired products. I am overwhelmingly disappointed in this Logitech Product. The cursor skips and stalls consistently out of the box. The support bulletin says to place [their] Bluetooth adapter is a closer location to the mouse and remove all objects between it and the mouse. That helps somewhat, but moving from one side of my MacBook Pro to the other is only 15”! This device has been completely unreliable and consistently gimpy. I still don’t know why Logitech doesn’t have you sync it to the Bluetooth receiver on your computer 🙄
customer_reviews.author: Griner

customer_reviews.title: Still Working After 4 Years
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with this mouse, over 4 years and it's still works great. If you're not a gamer, then this mouse is great for everything else for the most part. Fits the hand nicely, battery life is very long, probably I switch out the battery(1 AAA) once or twice a year, it doesn't happen alot, so I really don't keep track of it. It has fell several times off the desk, and nothing has broken, so it's built well.
customer_reviews.author: SoulD

customer_reviews.title: I love the trackball but...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th or 5th trackball. I've been hooked since they first came out. My oldest wired one died so I ordered the wireless version. I already own one that is on another computer. This new one is a little off. What I mean is the trackball socket doesn't let the ball move as freely as it should. I've taken the ball out and made sure there was nothing blocking it and I couldn't find an issue, and the issue doesn't happen all the time...weird. Like right now its super smooth. But the next time I use it, it might be a little sticky. Again...weird. But I still love it and will be ordering another for my new computer.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Anne Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Great when it works but fails after a few months
customer_reviews.text: This is the second mouse in less than a year. The first one failed after a few months. I spent many hours trying to get customer support for a replacement from Logitech, it took hours of hold time on the phone and then finally they make you go through torturous troubleshooting, not simply involving the mouse. After that, they approved my replacement but before they send it they make you go through more troubleshooting emails. I finally did receive a replacement but now that the second one failed after a few months, I am giving up. It is a shame because I like the design.
customer_reviews.author: Randy M.

customer_reviews.title: Bring back the old design
customer_reviews.text: I have been using trackball's since the late 90's. Sadly over the years Logitech has so reduced the quality of the material used in their buttons you are lucky to get more than 18mo before one or more buttons stop functioning properly. When you reach out to Logitech about this issue, they blame it on software. Sorry that is a false excuse. Love the feel and use, but hate the short life. thus the low star rating.
customer_reviews.author: ray

customer_reviews.title: Works, but I have range problems
customer_reviews.text: I really like this trackball. It feels a bit cheap -- the ball motion is a little sticky for me. I'd like ball bearings. But that still is ok for a trackball of this price. What the real problem is, is that the pointer "stutters" because I'm on the edge of the wireless range. My USB dongle is in my laptop, less than two feet away. I had to move it closer -- approx. 6 inches to get smooth motion of the mouse pointer. I have another Logitech mouse on the same dongle and it has smooth motion 10 feet away, where this trackball loses all connection.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Why use any other mouse?
customer_reviews.text: I have been using versions of this mouse for the past 15 years and I find every other type of mouse very awkward. I still do not understand why people prefer a mouse that needs real estate on a desk and requires full arm movement to operate. This cordless model frees up port space on my little travel laptop, but since the mouse does not move anyway, the cord is not the same inconvenience as it is in a non-trackball mouse. I don't use a mouse for gaming, but I do use it for making graphics and I find it much more sensitive for that process than a conventional mouse. Seriously - why would anyone use any other mouse?
customer_reviews.author: JLC

customer_reviews.title: I love these, but its not perfect for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I found years ago that I prefer trackballs. The one made by Logitech has been a dependable and constant presence on my desk. This is actually my fourth over the last 15 years. I have 2 others that are still working, but starting to show some wear, so I decided to get a new one. I can already see the improvements. This one only requires a single battery and the buttons include special forward/back buttons for apps. The only problem I've found is that some games struggle to work with the trackball as they read direction based on the movement of the mouse, and a trackball moves differently. But for the type of stuff I do, its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mvargus

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable in the hand
customer_reviews.text: I have always favored a trackball controller over a mouse. Simple reason: My desk is a mess and there is little room clear for moving a mouse around. A trackball sits in one place and doesn't demand open space on the desk. And this model is the most comfortable one I have ever used, and an improvement over my prior Logitech devices in that regard. And the wireless feature is icing on the cake. One less wire to worry about. I did not rate battery life as I have not owned the device long enough to make an intelligent observation.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Adamek

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to use for hours
customer_reviews.text: I have not been a fan of regular mice (mouses?) for years, since I have discovered the Trackball. I will say that they are susceptible to breakdown, so this is probably my 4th over the last 10 years or so. Not a bad track record. The battery lasts forever (in my last one, the battery outlasted the breakdown). There's a tiny learning curve if you're used to moving a mouse around on the pad, but another benefit if you can get rid of your mouse pad and just stabilize your wrist on a wrist rest, your hand/the mouse doesn't move at all.
customer_reviews.author: IE

customer_reviews.title: love my m570.
customer_reviews.text: this replaced an old m570 that i had. it wouldn't move around as easily as it had. this new one works like a charm. it's at a decent price, so if the ball doesn't move around as nicely anymore, or the buttons stop working like they should, i'll just get another one. my hands are on the smaller size and this trackball is the perfect size. don't have to look at it to press any of the buttons and you can customize them. the scroll wheel it nice. i have it set to be a double click if i press it. hate a mouse, but i LOVE my trackball!
customer_reviews.author: pat l

customer_reviews.title: Horrid Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awful. I purchased based on the reviews and I have used track balls in the past with much success. The weird placement of the ball is strange and the ball gets stuck so the scrolling is not good at all the ball needs to be fluid and this one isn't its like there is sand or something in it. Not sure how this was so highly rated.
customer_reviews.author: tmybrgr

customer_reviews.title: Used it for 2 days, and switched back to my old worn-out mouse... "Caveat Emptor!"
customer_reviews.text: Pro: * Plug n' Play was flawless Cons: * Overpriced, for the quality of the product. * I've used several Trackball's, and this is the first one that feels small under my palm. * Ball-action is rough/choppy... both on the mouse, AND on the screen. * Ball/Buttons/Shape = NOT ergonomic. Layout is poor. Overall: I get the feeling this is not really a Logitech. It seems more like a wannabe (like Logeetech, or Legitech). If this is the actual, for-real brand, then it must be like when Stanley bought out B&D/DeWalt, and then the latter turned to garbage. This is only my opinion, mind you!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It works great, I love using a trackball, and the buttons to browse back and forward are nice. Adjustable scroll bar is really nice to have, and buttons work fine. I clean it out about once a month with a damp cue-tip. Only negative is that after 3-5 years it wears out and the button clicks aren't reliable. Then I buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Walter B

customer_reviews.title: The best around
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible trackball; the best around on the market that I can tell. Years ago I'd encountered Microsoft's trackball and loved it. They ceased production and then I encountered Logitech's. While it's smaller than Microsoft's, it's the best that I can find on the market. Especially with the price being so reasonable, this is a yearly thing on my Christmas list as they tend to wear out after about a year.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Didn't come with the USB receiver
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the same item I had for years. I had to replace the first one because it fell on the ground and the forward button got stuck causing my computer to freeze. Overall, I like it. It's not precise enough to be very good for gaming and trickier to use your thumb for a lot of games. The one I received did not have the USB receiver even though it's in the picture. I had the one from the first mouse, so it wasn't that big of a deal and didn't inform the seller. Now, I actually need it and a replacement is $12. :(
customer_reviews.author: Stace Karussos

customer_reviews.title: My first one lasted me 9 years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these 9 years ago and its been great. After 9 years of use, abuse, and extensive traveling, it finally started acting up. The cursor tracking is still perfect, however it will now click and release even when the button is held. Also worth noting, in those 9 years, I probably used 4 batteries in total. This thing has been great and I'm happy to purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: D. Burns

customer_reviews.title: I Should Have Made This Change Years Ago
customer_reviews.text: I am digital artist. At my work station I use a mouse (as well as an Wacom tablet) for hours each day working Photoshop and other digital manipulation software. I am working among three large screens. I got this mouse yesterday and been working with it now for about 8 hours. I had been using a cheap mouse. What a change. The functionality is much improved over a standard mouse. The movement of my hand/mouse among my screens has been cut by +/- 50%. These improvements have made my creative process much more fiuld. I should have made this change years ago.
customer_reviews.author: G. John Guild

customer_reviews.title: Logitech M570 Wireless Trackball Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I switched to the trackball Mouse years ago. My wrist started hurting and my Dr. recommended that I switch. Once you switch you will never go back to a mouse, especially when you have 3 screens. You don't have to keep picking up the mouse when you run out of room on your pad. Takes about 2 weeks to get used to a trackball. Always get the one where you use your thumb. They used to make these trackballs that were wired. I switched to one that was wireless with batteries and it didn't work well - that was years ago. It kept dropping the connection. Several years later I tried again. So much better. The connection never drops now.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Straw

customer_reviews.title: Love the rollerball
customer_reviews.text: I have used a rollerball for years, but the old one was wired. I thought it about time I got wireless. My only complaint is when I received the package I could not for the life of me find the USB receiver. So I thought it was left out of package. Well it was located under the battery cover beside the battery. It would of been nice if they had just indicated that somewhere on box since I had not reason to look inside battery cover A arrow pull out was indicated to remove and battery was ready to go. One less wire to care about
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: stopped tracking the ball after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace mouse for laptop so I could avoid moving mouse on my laptop knee pad which is small... It worked well for about 20-25 days then the ball would turn and not register on the laptop... A regular mouse works fine so I know it's not my laptop... I returned on the last day before I couldn't return thankfully... I wanted this to work but it just didn't... Also it's not ergonomic for small hands it's huge and was uncomfortable in my small hands... Don't buy if your hands are small you won't be happy...
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Have several Logitech trackball
customer_reviews.text: What have Logitech done to their trackball. The most recent purchase was made in 3/19. By July, 2019, had issue with the trackball. Switched back to my older trackball. Currently, the clicking doesnt seem to connect to the pointer well. Today, I tried my newer model. NOTHING happening. Looking for something different that LOGITECH. Guess its time I leave LOGITECH TRACKBALL behind. Giving three stars to long history of excellence and reliability that appear to be modified. Sure the price is great. But maybe that is the issue, price great, quality isnt o what it used to be
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Love them, but they don't last
customer_reviews.text: I've been a trackball person for probably over 10 years and have purchases this exact device at least 5 times or more. Just purchased a new one. I love this trackball. It performs marvelously when it's fresh out of the box...for about a year. Then you start to notice that the buttons aren't as responsive as they used to be which ruins productivity. Generally I keep using it until it gets to be too frustrating, order another one and repeat the cycle. For any other product I'd be writing a bad review, but $26 for a new trackball every couple of years isn't exactly worth complaining about. If they keep making them, I'll keep buying them.
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly...fails suddenly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for ergo reasons 14 months ago. Lovely device, and worked flawlessly. I cleaned the trackball sensors every 3-4 months, which was easy. Then, one day, with no warning, my MacBook Pro started freezing every 10 seconds or so. I did everything (restarted, disconnected devices, etc.) and discovered it was the M570 and its USB plugin attachment. Unplugging fixed everything...replugging caused the same problem. I've filed a warranty claim (it's got a 3-year warranty) online, which was fairly quick and easy, and I'll see how long it takes for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Jahan

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse ever!
customer_reviews.text: I was getting cramps in my mouse hand from the other models I have so I tried this one and the thumb movement with the track ball has straightend me out. I have a vertical ergonomic mouse that didn't do the trick and two gaming models that I guess I gripped too hard becuase they would really get my hand cramping and stiff. I ended up buying this model, along with a case and I took it to work and back home every day for ages. I finally decided that I just needed to buy a second one to keep at the office. It was worth it to have two. I will never be without one going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret H

customer_reviews.title: Much easier on me than a regular mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Logitech makes great products. I have a genetic joint disorder, and this has made m life easier. I use this mouse for the 10 hours I spend at work every day, which results in multiple mouse moves and clicks. Now my thumb does most of the work and I find it so much easier and less painful than a regular mouse. I find that batteries last so much longer in Logitech products. I have the same battery in this trackball for close to 6 months now and it is at 70% per the Logitech app. I won't buy anything but Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Iron Mike

customer_reviews.title: Wrist and Arm Already Feel Better. Switched from standard wireless Logitech mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Using a regular mouse for too long at one time was hurting. I love Logitech mice for the smooth movement and quality, so I decided to give this a try. After a few hours, I got used to using it and was able to make the switch easily. I know I need to take better care of my arm and take some rests, but since I have to use my computer, this has helped. Arm feels better after just a week of use. As far as precision and speed, the mouse is fast and smooth. The trackball is precise and feels comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: NiteShopping

customer_reviews.title: Best trackball in the market.
customer_reviews.text: If you have good dexterity with your thumb this trackball is for you. It has the smoothest tracking of all the trackballs in the market IMHO. The battery lasts a long time. I use the inexpensive kind, use the trackball a lot, and I get at least 3 months of life on 1 single AA battery. Depending on your environment you may have to clean the ball rollers inside the socket bu simply pushing the ball out using a small hole at the bottom. Then a quick swipe and you're done. 5 seconds operation. It does have a drawback though...once you get used to this, you will never go back to using a regular mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Luther C. Marcena

customer_reviews.title: Very good mouse, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mouse. I have one for work and one at home. It works really well and the AA battery lasts for over 6 months before having to change it and I never turn off the mouse. I will buy this again and recommend others to buy it. Only disappointing thing is that the price has gone up 33% since I last purchased this mouse. Paid $20 in 2017, now it is $30. I was going to purchase more but since the price has gone up so much, I'll wait until I really have to get a new one. If wasn't for the big jump in price, I would give this 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bstnwhaler

customer_reviews.title: Is an Ok Mouse
customer_reviews.text: So been a Logitech guy for about 2 decades now. Have to say sadly was not as impressed with this mouse as some that I have had in the past. The track ball on it is not as smooth gliding as previous models. Plus the ball point connections need to be cleaned about once a week or you start having performance issues unlike previous models that would work fine between cleanings for a month or more. As said is an ok mouse but it doesn't meet Logitech's normal standards of quality in my opinion. But still better than a non trackball mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Page

customer_reviews.title: Helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I don't like this shape as much as the ones from about 20 years ago, and it took some getting used to, but it does help my carpal in multiple ways 1. Not having to squeeze, and 2. Not having to move my hand / wrist around as much. It is well made, but again, not as well made as the models from 20 years ago, so I am not sure whether it will have the same durability. I like it. It is attractive. My suggest is to try it and see whether it helps you as it was a super great reduced price!
customer_reviews.author: Nosnivel

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My first impressions on this mouse. It looks nice and functions pretty good. I bought this to use with Samsung DeX and it works beautifully. Only problem with this mouse I've seen and I think wiping the track ball off would help this, is it hesitates from time to time, but I also figured out that you have to leave the path to the sensor just about perfectly clear. Other than that I wouldn't use it for gaming, not trustworthy enough in my opinion. As for everyday use for work, play, etc. It's perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: No more wrist pain!
customer_reviews.text: I was having excruciating wrist pain every day after using a standard mouse. After using this trackball mouse, I no longer have wrist pain. My only issue is that the sensitivity when using this with an HD screen (43") the mouse movement often is not sensitive enough. It actually has a little bit of resistance in the ball movement where you can feel the friction grabbing and then releasing, causing it to just minutely jump. It makes it difficult to make precise alignments when trying to do things like resize a window or a cell in a spreadsheet. Have adjusted the mouse sensitivity with little success. Still, I love it overall and the buttons are very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: I don't get it
customer_reviews.text: maybe this is for people with different anatomy or hand problems from me. It actually excacerbated my hand pain, and couldn't track as well as a mouse with it, even after weeks of trying to adjust. If you're looking to buy: - go to an B&M store and try messing around with one first. if it hurts your thumb, it's probably not going to get better in my experience. - consider fashioning a wedge to place underneath - the default angle is pretty uncomfortable. Solidly built product, I just don't understand how it helps with ergonomics
customer_reviews.author: Dara K.

customer_reviews.title: This mouse does not consistently work properly
customer_reviews.text: I have used this model mouse for over 15 years and ordered this new mouse to replace my last mouse as the scroll button no longer functioned. This mouse worked at first and, within a short time, it would not work. I have tried updating the drivers on my computer, have tried replacing the battery, none of which has been successful. I suspect that the spring mechanism within the battery housing may not be fitted properly. I am very disappointed that I will have to spend more $ and purchase another one to replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Owens

customer_reviews.title: Love these trackballs!
customer_reviews.text: Love these trackballs! I am a pro photographer, using my trackball daily for extended periods of time. They last around 22-26 months, then I start to see noticable decline in sensitivity. My kids and wife use these as well, not as much as I do, and they are getting 3 to 4 years befpre they start to notice the problems. Well worth it for the money, great product, great trackball. Will be buying as long as they are available.
customer_reviews.author: D.Schibel

customer_reviews.title: The only mouse I like
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in my hands and I am also big into using Photoshop. I can get very fine movements with the ball for making selections in Photoshop, much better than I would with a regular mouse (of course not as refined as a pen) I started using this mouse years ago because I had a laptop and I could use it on any surface, like the couch or the dog's back. Now I use it because it is so easy on my hands. I have 3 of these all various ages. They last years with no trouble and batteries last months with regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Alicyn

customer_reviews.title: Works when it wants to
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel and most things about it. One problem, after a month of use, it keeps cutting out. This means that the cursor sometimes does not respond (including scroll etc). Right now I am attempting to move my mouse, and nothing happens. I followed the troubleshooting for this device, and no difference. New batteries, no signal interference, and other Logitech devices work fine on same USB port and same location. My return window is now closed, and I am left with a track ball that works sometimes. Wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Not easy for arthritis or carpal tunnel...
customer_reviews.text: Your enjoyment of this will vary greatly between individuals. I personally have large hands with the beginning of arthritis/carpal tunnel and this was a disaster for me. I don't have the mobility in my thumb to control the ball comfortably. The sensitivity is too high and it took too much to be beneficial for me. This works be better for people with no joint or hand issues which somewhat defeats the reason I bought it. The product does feel sturdy and decent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Been Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless trackball mouse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse to use at work because a previous wired trackball mouse had stopped performing properly and the replacement basic mouse was not to my liking. I really like the fact that the mouse is wireless. Thus, I don’t have to worry about catching a wire on anything. I also like that it is supposed to have a long battery life. I turn it off after I am done with it for the day to help preserve battery power. I like that it has a trackball so that I do not have to spend time lifting and moving the mouse around. It fits my hand perfectly and I would definitely buy it again if I needed one.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn L. Schenck

customer_reviews.title: Great use if it would work for more than warranteed!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the SECOND mouse (this exactly one) that I've purchased in two years. Works great and I love it, but right about warrantee time, both of them, just started acting wonky (I keep clean and maintenanced!) and one or both buttons stopped working each time! Only purchased the second one because the first one stopped working a WEEK after the warranty was up. Well, I was burned AGAIN! Learned my lesson, there will not be a third purchase of this item as they seem to work for about a year!
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Mullen

customer_reviews.title: Switches on buttons won't last 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: As far as ergonomics goes, this mouse is the best I've ever used. The problem is this product becomes useless very fast. The trackball moves easily at first, but eventually becomes harder and harder to move. Also the button switches degrade very fast. In fact my current mouse (second one) mis-clicked straight out of the box. If you are happy buying a new mouse every six months then this is the mouse for you. Or, if like me, you can solder better quality after market switches into this you can make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Bellisle

customer_reviews.title: Good for a home theatre PC
customer_reviews.text: I have an older wired version similar to this unit hooked to one of my other computers, so I'm familiar with how to use it. I bought this one to use with my secondary home theatre PC. This mouse sits next to me on the futon, where it's easy to reach, and has good range, easily connecting to the PC, which is about 7-8 feet away. A nice feature is it shares the dongle with the Logitech wireless keyboard (K400+) I use on this PC. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Just another sane, rational Floridian

customer_reviews.title: This is a trackball - not a mouse
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure I will keep this trackball long term. A trackball takes a very steady thumb to select small graphics or when highlighting text - my hands are not that steady. The controls are well laid out and it is comfortable to use. I am not sure it will survive a fall from my desk - which happens often. My apple mouse remains my favorite due to its heft and precision, but this is an interesting option. I am using this trackball with my Surface Pro in my home office. Connecting was plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: brianatl01

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved this mouse, until it stopped working after 3 months. I think it was the ball that broke (although cosmetically the mouse looks exactly the same) - one day I came in and the scrolling on the mouse wasn't triggering unless I was holding the mouse in the air in my hand and upside down (which proves that it wasn't my computer that had an issue, rather it was the hardware, the mouse itself). Conveniently stopped working right after the Amazon return window... Too bad because it was a cool mouse but never again will I purchase anything Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: My favorite mouse
customer_reviews.text: I started using Logitech Trackball mice when I was doing a lot of CAD work in the early 80's. It was a lot less stress on the arm after working all day! I've been using them almost exclusively ever since. This is the third of this model I've purchased, for a third PC. This one is a new PC used for 4K UHD video streaming. This wireless model has the added advantage of being able to be used on a table across the room from the PC next to the recliner!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Young

customer_reviews.title: Solid bargain
customer_reviews.text: This is my second M570, the last one having broken after three or so years, and likely my fault for having disassembled it because it really, really needed cleaning. I'd prefer a wired trackball, but those are rare, typically of poorer quality, and lacking the features and design of this, so this'll do. Not much else to say, it works out of the box with Linux, no software needed, perfectly balanced speed, everything just works which is what I want out of a trackball.
customer_reviews.author: Javarod

customer_reviews.title: Gotta love my trackball
customer_reviews.text: I've used a trackball since...ready? 1996! I've replace them a couple of times after I wear them out. But last year I couldn't find my "old" trackball and took a chance on the "new" style - always has to be Logitech because nobody else makes a decent trackball mouse. I was nervous about using a cordless, thinking the battery would die often. I've been using my mouse for a year and only a couple of weeks ago the battery died. I keep rechargeable batteries on hand so that's not a problem. It's been great! I don't use my computer for gaming, but I'm sure it would be good there too.
customer_reviews.author: T. Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Improved my Carpal Tunnel and Tendinitis
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned this mouse and loved it, when it was not acting right my father gave me another with the finger trackball instead of the thumb ball. After more than a year of using it my hands began going numb and I would loose control. It became painful and began affecting my day-to-day life, eventually I saw a doctor. I was diagnosed with Carpal Tunnel and started therapy. I began focusing the causes of the flair ups. First thing I changed was back to my original trackball. Improvement came quickly after that. I’ll never go back.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Haines

customer_reviews.title: This trackball is o,k...
customer_reviews.text: The trackball itself worked okay. I had bought one before from Best Buy around 2008, which I'm still using as of today. Love it. Haven't had no problems what so ever. That is the reason why I purchased another for my lab top, the same type of trackball. This one, this time seem to have a little rough push & roll to the ball itself. But, still rolls ok... I put a little oil on it overnight, wipe it off and it perform much better that way. So, I'm giving it a 4 stars for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Towerpower5

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for wired Logitech trackball
customer_reviews.text: My wired Logitech trackballs finally gave up after more than a decade of use and they are no longer made. I’ve had a couple of these wireless trackballs but they tend to skip or lose connection making for an annoying user experience. I was hoping this newer one would have a better Bluetooth connection and yes it does! Smooth cursor movement, no skips and no loss of connection. I don’t miss the wired trackballs at all. Just hope it stays that way.
customer_reviews.author: JD3rdPig

customer_reviews.title: it has become just as easy as a regular ball mouse
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a ball mouse for many years but it still took a couple of weeks to get used to a thumb mouse. After some initial growing pains, it has become just as easy as a regular ball mouse, and much better than any traditional mouse or lap top pad. I also really like the scroll wheel and use it all the time. Great that it comes with a high quality Duracell battery, already installed. Typically, one battery will last at least 6 months under regular use. I have been using mine for several years and have 2 others just like it.
customer_reviews.author: RC Beach Flyer

customer_reviews.title: The Best Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these mice since they were beige and wired (with the red ball) and I love them. Recently I needed a new one so I could switch easily between work and home laptops and Logitech is still making them well. I know many people aren't even familiar with the trackball concept and it is always funny to watch them try to use my mouse, but for me these are a life changer. I actually had to have physical therapy for my back/shoulder when using a conventional mouse and now I have no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: The Gadget Guy

customer_reviews.title: LOGITECH TRACKBALL MOUSE
customer_reviews.text: In getting right to the point I had purchased two of these since I had Carpal Tunnel issues. One failed> I have to admit that it was challenging to communicate at first; however, Logitech came through and sent me a free replacement which works the way that it should. Great service! Thank You. Fast ship. Professional packaging. Great communication. Will recommend highly. A JOB WELL ORCHESTRATED FROM START TO FINISH. Just perfect! Thank you. Anthony. H Burlington, MA.
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY HAMBOYAN

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this mouse for about a month now and honestly i would be very hesitant to go back to a normal mouse. My experience has been great. Some people said your hand might get cramped up or sore and I never experienced any of that. The only difficulty I ran into was that the ball, when it gets dirty, can stick and not move as easily. However, after a quick clean it was back to working well. I highly recommend this mouse, great experience
customer_reviews.author: Adam F

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for 30$ but not sure about the bluetooth adapter
customer_reviews.text: Works great was bigger than I thought still at times will make my wrist sore and a little uncomfortable in fair I'm not using a mouse pad or any support at all so probably my fault not the mouse really fast and responsive to touch made using my new laptop totally different wont use it without this mouse and I love the extra buttons for short cuts but I havnt been able to get anything else to connect to the bluetooth adapter says 6 devices at once but it was plug and play with the mouse as soon as you plug it in its ready to use
customer_reviews.author: Carl Stricklett

customer_reviews.title: Unnaturally rounded hand position cramped my hand and numbed my fingers
customer_reviews.text: I have used a trackball mouse for over 10 years. When my old one died and I couldn't get an identical replacement, I bought the M570 based on reviews on Amazon and other sites. The configuration is a much greater bell curve than my old mouse, and after several days of forcing myself to use the M570, my ring and pinkie fingers were numb and the numbness travelled halfway up my arm; my whole hand cramped. Had to give away the mouse and get something completely different (a Contour Red, like I have at work). Just be aware that the hand position on this mouse may not work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Diane F.

customer_reviews.title: Often responds sluggishly
customer_reviews.text: Feels good underhand, but after a couple of weeks of use, it sometimes fails to respond. That is, I move the trackball, but the cursor only sort of responds--kind of like the bad old days when your mechanical mouse got dirty. It's not a battery issue--i replaced those and no improvement. It's intermittent enough to give me hope but then frustrate the heck out me later. I would return it, but it got wonky right around the time the return window closed. There seem to be quite a few others with this same problem.
customer_reviews.author: RScott

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love my new trackball mouse. It took me a little bit to get used to because I was used to the optical one that you move around to move the trackball. This trackball mouse stays stationary and I control the ball with my thumb. I love it. I can use it on any surface, unlike the more traditional mouse where you have to make sure you have space and a pretty flat, level surface to operate it. The extra money was worth the investment. I will never go back to the traditional mouse..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this (and so does my wrist)
customer_reviews.text: I built a new music studio set up in my house with a new desk and computer. I was using the Apple Magic Mouse but after extended mixing sessions my wrist wasn't happy (pain and fatigue). I decided to try a track ball and this one was very highly rated. The addition of this as well as a wrist rest made all the difference for me. Initially it took a little getting used to but now I feel just as quick and accurate as I was with the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Caudill

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Man love that it only uses one battery instead of two. I had kept turning mine off after I was done using it to save battery life but I found very little difference from just letting it go to sleep. You do have to occasionally clean out the dust that collects on the bearings under the ball. But that's as simple as pushing out the ball from underneath. Once you clean it out it's back to smooth as butter just like the first time you started using it.
customer_reviews.author: IzzuThug

customer_reviews.title: Bear Hand Rests Like A Glove
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had the rat {no way this thing's a mouse} long enough to write about its reliability, but so far it's been an absolute pleasure to use. My bear hand's never had a more comfortable mold to rest on. There's no more desk shaking from dragging the rat around. The trackball will take getting used to, but nothing that seems like an impossible task. Functionality is limited on the Mac [perhaps there's an app to accommodate?] but all features work on Windows. I think I found a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The trackball is the black sheep of cursor controll
customer_reviews.text: I work in IT/Development and I wanted something that would feel comfortable in my hand all day and could command precise movement. This Logitech trackball does all that and more. If you are not used to a trackball this is a little tricky at first but give it some time and you will throw away the mouse for superior precision. It works great for day to day computer use, Photoshop, office work and gaming. The battery life is long lasting and I have had no issues with the product. If you are looking into a trackball, I would recommend this guy to enhance your computer needs.
customer_reviews.author: Caligula Strange

customer_reviews.title: My favorite track ball
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this model. If you want to use your thumb on a trackball, this unit is for you. They are reliable, though I've worn through one after about five years of use. That seems reasonable. You'll want to pull the ball off and clean the contacts with a q-tip every month or so. Once the feel starts changing, you'll know you need to do it. An odd thing... I've owned three, and each one had a different initial feel to the ball. Sometimes they start out really stiff, and sometimes not. If yours is a little too hard for you, just give it a couple of weeks and it'll break in.
customer_reviews.author: ihsan

customer_reviews.title: Better than a mouse!!
customer_reviews.text: It takes some getting used to if you’ve never used a track ball! I had an hour or so where I had to adjust my instinct to move it around on the desk. The Upside is that if you use it at work, nobody will borrow your computer... especially if you pair it with a split keyboard (insert evil laugh here...)!! The trackball is a bit grainy feeling but it works very well and overall is super responsive. It would be nice if it was a bit more tilted... there are some great ideas from other reviewers on how they customized this though. Definitely better than a mouse! Quick easy set-up also.
customer_reviews.author: Jilly P

customer_reviews.title: Best Mouse I've Owned!
customer_reviews.text: What a great mouse! This is my first trackball - a decision I made due to having dual 27" monitors on my desk and having to move a mouse from the side of one screen to the other was a significant distance. While I know I can adjust the sensitivity, I didn't like the "feel" of that. So I went trackball..... First and foremost, this is comfortable for large hands (I wear XXL gloves). My hand rests on it nicely with quick access to all the programmable buttons. The trackball itself is large enough to be easy to use, yet accurate too! Just a great mouse - I ended up buying a second one for another computer!
customer_reviews.author: That One Guy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Mouse for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This thing fits perfect for my needs. I move around for work a lot for meetings and have impromptu meetings at all corners of the office. This work well for me as it can be placed at the end of a desk or on my lap and I have no need to move the mouse around, just my thumb. As an athlete (Fencer) it also helps me to exercise my thumb everyday continuously. This keeps my grip on my blade with flexibility on point. If I do hurt my thumb in training, it gives me a form of therapy always moving the thumb. Just overall perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Ph@raoh

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but won't order another.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this mouse when it works. It's so incredibly comfortable and the fact that it is wireless is a plus. The issue is I've gone through my second in about a year's time. They just have not lasted. Both have stopped responding to the track ball movements. The weird thing is this: I bought one for my wife when I first purchased mine and it is still going strong. Not sure if I just got to defective ones, but I'm not buying a 3rd. I'm going to try for a different one and see if it has more longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Chrys B.

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight Plastic
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, I like the mouse and it solved the pain in my right wrist, but the lightweight plastic is annoying. Any bump will cause the mouse to move across the pad, and when you're scrolling through tons of documents you notice the cheaper build quality. I've been a long time fan of Logitech and always look to buy their products first, but this mouse has me second guessing that.
customer_reviews.author: Sabetha Danes

customer_reviews.title: great shape and it has a scroll wheel
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a track ball that has a scroll wheel. This is perfect. Track ball takes a little getting used to but I love the benefit to my hand. I've had carpal tunnel surgery in the past and used a track ball ever since. On the rare occasions that I need to use a regular mouse I find that my wrist doesn't last long. Get the zip up clamshell case is you need to carry this in a briefcase. Love this mouse. The battery compartment safely stores the usb connector when not in use. Been using this for a couple months, battery life is great, even when forget to turn it off at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: A Miracle for Wrist Pain
customer_reviews.text: I got this mouse to help alleviate wrist pain and am happy to report that it's greatly decreased my pain! :) It is plug and play, has a sturdy construction, is comfortable for my hand, and I haven't had any issues with it at all. I thought it would take a while to adapt to the trackball style, but I got the hang of it within minutes and find it fun to spin the ball with my thumb now. I've been using it for about a month and haven't had to replace the battery yet despite leaving it turned on and using it for hours every day. I would highly recommend this mouse to anyone with wrist pain.
customer_reviews.author: PencilStubs

customer_reviews.title: Wont work...
customer_reviews.text: I received my mouse and tried to connect to blue tooth and it would not work, I called customer support and it turns out you have to use the usb hub provided. You put that in your computer and THEN the mouse will work. My computer is the new C-USB connection so I had to use a connector extension to make it work... Check your device and make sure you can plug the USB into it some how or it will not work! So far I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Foster

customer_reviews.title: It's Logitech.  What more do you need to know?
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Logitech products probably as long as they have been around. I still have my original 3 button trackball and it works fine but the cords I'm growing are staring to bug me. This is exactly what I would expect from Logitech. Works flawlessly. Works on my Ubuntu machine also. I like a quickly reacting trackball over a mouse for gaming, my son has always preferred a mouse and I think most gamers do. Just a preference.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C.

customer_reviews.title: Not ergonomic.  Maintains hand position as a regular mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is interesting in that track ball makes it a space saver. It takes some getting used to though, tired out my thumbs. I have been using a vertical mouse (by Shark), which I love, but I damaged the usb received. I tried logitech because many other brands are not compatible with MAC and logitech has a universal receiver. However, this mouse does not alleviate the wrist positioning issues for me that I experience with a regular mouse, whereas the vertical mouse did so immediately upon first use. I have only been using this logitech mouse for a few hours and my wrist is bothering me.
customer_reviews.author: Cac

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Mouse - Feels a Tad Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for when laying in bed without needing a mouse pad, does it perfectly for what I wanted. Not the best mouse, as the title implies, feel a tad wimpy, very light compared to my regular workhorse, Corsair mouse. Remnants of yesteryear's computing orbs, which I may replace with a stainless steel bearing instead... which the stock ones seems like it would break easy. Last orb mouse I used was made of clay... but that was like 20 years ago. I would buy more and do recommend it if you need it for basic stuff.... I would not use it for gaming, the DPI cannot be adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good item, poor quality, lasted about 60 days
customer_reviews.text: I got my eye that the item came in a simple plastic bag, not a box as you can find them in stores. The item looked new and un-used, everything worked well for about 2 months, then it become intermittent, cursor was teleporting across my screen, scroll bar did not scroll and back and ford buttons worked every other time. I cleaned and tested with another computer, same results, the symptoms intensified and now (at the 3,5month mark) it's really painful to used it. Unfortunately, I am beyond the 30days warranty by the seller and nothing can be done (already contacted the seller)....I think this is a refurbished item,
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Baeza

customer_reviews.title: Stalls
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this upon realizing I was causing repeated movement problems in my two middle fingers from using my Apple Trackpad. Ergonomically this device is great. In my experience of just over a month (past the return window) however, it is not reliable. There are times that it just dies/locks/stalls. It doesn't seem to work on my desk without a piece of white paper underneath it. Sometimes the roller ball doesn't keep up to speed. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: TruthInLove

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ergonomics, mediocre longevity
customer_reviews.text: I won't expound at length on what other people already have written in detail about. 2nd to none in ergonomics, I do massive projects that would have left me crippled with anything else. Short lived switches (button & roller). I've had the original corded trackball, M570 and that stupid floppy Logitech MX Ergo Wireless. I think both use the same switches - again, short lived. When was the last time your standard keyboard blew out a key? It can be done. This time I'm filing a warranty claim to see what happens. Our purpose isn't to keep the delivery people in business.
customer_reviews.author: Shalmaneser

customer_reviews.title: You a Baller? I am!  Good for travel, mouse work in limited space or without a flat surface.
customer_reviews.text: I Love track balls. Most of the young professionals look at me weird for using it. They definitely have their advantages. If you are a pro gamer this is likely not the mouse for you. you will have more control with a normal mouse. I do game with this mouse but not FPS so its perfectly fine for MMO's and less time/space critical games. These are great to put in your laptop bag for use in flights or other times a traditional mouse will have its limitations. I have heard they are going away but they always seem to be available. I think they have a bit of a cult like following... wheres the robe? :)
customer_reviews.author: BuzzlitebeerTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: this is not what i ordered it for
customer_reviews.text: I used to love track ball mouses because of limited space and thought it would work with my Reolink camera system it did not. I wanted something wireless so I could sit in my chair and change the cameras. Since its not really amazons fault I took my longer wireless mouse to the camera system and used this one for my laptop. Not what I intended but the mouse is cool just doesn't work with reolink. And to make sure everyone knows it was cool enough to keep and not send back.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I didn't rate this track ball for gaming because I don't use it that way. I also didn't rate the battery life because I have only had it for a month. It has been constantly on for the whole month with no problems. I have big hands while my wife has small hands and it works well ergonomically for both of us. This is our second track ball and this one is very smooth rolling the ball and the buttons have a crisp and definite clicking action. Its wireless connection is very useful in that you can place it anywhere. It frees up desk space. No negatives so far
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Takes getting used to.
customer_reviews.text: I like that I my hand doesn't have to travel over the desk. I can put a little side table by my office chair and only move my fingers. <---super lazy I know. One thing, apparently I have a slight tremor in my thumb. I didn't notice it until I started using this mouse. It becomes an issue when trying to click on a small box. This is especially true after I drink caffeine. Other than that... I'm sure there's a way to reduce the sensitivity. Might be tricky at work since I don't have admin privileges.
customer_reviews.author: Lswworth

customer_reviews.title: Slightly flawed on MacOS but well worth it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this model or similar on Windows for years but finally decided to get one for my iMac as well since I now have a free USB port after shuffling some accessories around. There are three reasons I’m taking away a star. Two I knew in advance and those are a required USB dongle instead of Bluetooth and AAA battery instead of rechargeable. Third is it doesn’t support horizontal scroll from my experience. None of these are more than an annoyance for me and overall the comfort and ease of use make this an indispensable peripheral especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: K. Brown
